moves.1. e4 g6: this may very well be the first time, an opponent surprised me straight from the first move...
moves.2. d4 Bg7 3. Nf3 d6 4. Be3: played from the gut: I had no idea, what was happening here; in fact, this is still theory: the Modern Defense, to be precise...
moves.4... Nf6 5. Bd3 O-O 6. O-O Bg4: clearly too agressive: better is c5, c3, Ng4...
moves.7. h3 Bxf3 8. Qxf3 c6: Black is already on slippery grounds: better Nfd7, c3, c5, Nd2...
moves.9. Nd2 Nbd7 10. c3 e5 11. Nc4 Qe7: better exd4, Bxd4, d5, exd5, etcetera, and release some tensions...
moves.17. Bg5: forcing Nf6 to a bad square: after Nh5 or Nd7, White plays Bc4 and attacking f7; after Qd6/e7, Rd2, followed by Rad1...
moves.17... Nd7 18. Bc4 Nf8: weak and losing: after Nc5, Rd2, a6, Black has better chances...
moves.19. Rd2 h6: the final flaw: only after Ne6 - the only reason for Nf8, in the first place - Black can hope to survive...
moves.20... hxg5: somewhat tougher was b5, axb5, cxb5, Bb3, hxg5...
moves.21. Rd2d7 Nxd7: no difference makes Qxd7, Rxd7, Nxd7...
